column4: well its the game "tremulous". It had a script I run with sh ./
it is supposed to use an un-install script that uses a .loki directory
but all I get is  "NO usable uninstall found. Abording"
seems many things I took out with synaptic are left here.......
You mean in your home dir?
Those are your personal config files for those apps. They won't be removed when you remove the app.
Synaptic uses apt-get as its back end
Did you install that game using wine?
the locate command searches the slocate database, that database is created with updatedb.
And, yes, I believe updatedb takes into account the entire file system.
I would say that is correct.
if you just created a file, no.. locate won't see it until you do sudo updatedb, then locate will see it
the index is updated when you run sudo updatedb
